item.title: Perspectives on Dpi
item.description: DPI strange and confusing So what is DPI? It stands for dots per inch. One inch is 25,40mm So 300 DPI means that for each 25,40 millimeters, there are 300 dots / pixels. So you wish to have high quality pictures from a technical perspective? You need high DPI right? Well not quite, it’s actually not that simple. A picture file, lets say a .jpg file without changeing the file one bit, can be concidered to have multiple DPI’s.
